item.title: 意大利 Bending Spoons 公司准备 IPO，警告人工智能泡沫
item.description: 意大利科技公司 Bending Spoons 的首席执行官告诉路透社，该公司最早可能在明年上市，预计在收购视频流媒体平台 Vimeo 和门户网站 AOL 之后，调整后的盈利将翻一番。【原文：Italian tech company Bending Spoons could list as early as next year, when it expects to double adjusted earnings after buying video streaming platform Vimeo and web portal AOL, its chief executive told Reuters.】

item.title: 早间竞价美联储降息现在是掷硬币
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 星巴克工会咖啡师将在 40 个城市举行罢工，推动合同谈判
item.description: 星巴克工会称，美国 40 多个城市的 1000 多名星巴克工会咖啡师于周四发起了一场无休止的罢工，进一步推动该咖啡巨头就薪酬和其他福利问题达成集体谈判协议。【原文：More than 1,000 Starbucks unionized baristas in over 40 U.S. cities launched an open-ended strike on Thursday, the union said, escalating their push for a collective bargaining agreement over pay and other benefits at the coffee giant.】

item.title: 迪士尼提高股息和回购，乐园和流媒体推动利润增长
item.description: 华特迪士尼周四表示，将把 2026 财年的股息提高 50%，并把股票回购计划增加一倍，因为这家媒体巨头的流媒体和乐园业务推动了季度盈利的增长。【原文：Walt Disney said on Thursday it would boost its dividend by 50% and double its share buyback plan for fiscal 2026, as the media giant's streaming and parks businesses powered a quarterly earnings beat.】

item.title: 大空头》的迈克尔-伯里注销了 Scion 资产管理公司的注册资格
item.description: 因在 2008 年成功押注美国房地产市场而闻名的 "大空头 "投资者迈克尔-伯利（Michael Burry）已注销了他的对冲基金 Scion Asset Management。【原文："Big Short" investor Michael Burry, known for his successful bets against the U.S. housing market in 2008, has deregistered his hedge fund, Scion Asset Management.】

item.title: 美国农业部数据封锁加剧了即将发布的作物报告前的不确定性
item.description: 在美国政府有史以来最长的一次停摆期间，农作物数据被封锁，导致分析师对玉米和大豆产量的估计出现了十年来最大的差异，因为在收获时节和关键的贸易谈判期间出现的信息真空扭曲了美国两种最有价值农作物的市场。【原文：A crop data blackout during the longest-ever U.S. government shutdown has led to the widest range of analyst estimates in a decade for corn and soybean yields, as an information vacuum at harvest time and during critical trade negotiations distorted the market for the country's two most valuable crops.】

item.title: 民主党高层抨击特朗普推迟对华出口限制措施
item.description: 包括参议院少数党领袖查克-舒默（Chuck Schumer）在内的参议院民主党高层人士周三抨击特朗普政府在上一轮与中国政府的贸易谈判中暂停一项阻止数千家中国公司获取美国技术的措施，称其为 "放弃关键的国家安全工具"。【原文：Top Senate Democrats including Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer took aim at the Trump administration on Wednesday for suspending a measure that blocked thousands of Chinese companies from accessing U.S. technology in the last round of trade talks with Beijing, calling it a "giveaway of key national security tools."】

item.title: 日经》报道：日产考虑与本田在美国合作开发汽车
item.description: 日产汽车公司首席执行官伊万-埃斯皮诺萨（Ivan Espinosa）周四告诉《日经商业日报》，日产汽车公司正在考虑与本田汽车公司在美国联合开发汽车和动力总成项目。【原文：Nissan Motor is considering a joint project for vehicle and powertrain development with Honda Motor in the U.S., Nissan CEO Ivan Espinosa told the Nikkei business daily on Thursday.】

item.title: 地区联储银行可能成为特朗普施压的下一个阵地
item.description: 随着美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）寻求对利率和其他政策施加更多影响，美联储 12 位地区银行行长的重新任命这一历来例行的程序正受到关注，以寻找是否会成为对美国中央银行独立性的最新挑战的迹象。【原文：The historically routine process of reappointing the Federal Reserve's 12 regional bank presidents is being watched for signs of becoming the newest challenge to the U.S. central bank's independence, as President Donald Trump seeks more influence over interest rates and other policies.】

item.title: 美国政府重新开放，但深刻的政治分歧依然存在
item.description: 在美国历史上最长的一次停摆导致空中交通受阻、低收入美国人的食品援助被削减、100 多万工人的工资被迫拖欠一个多月之后，美国政府将于周四恢复运转。【原文：The U.S. government is due to lumber back to life on Thursday after the longest shutdown in U.S. history snarled air traffic, cut food assistance to low-income Americans and forced more than 1 million workers to go unpaid for more than a month.】

item.title: 美联储重启后交易员等待数据，美国期货走势低迷
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普签署法案结束美国历史上最长的政府关门之后，投资者在等待有关美国经济和货币政策走向的迹象，华尔街期货周四表现低迷。【原文：Wall Street futures were subdued on Thursday as investors awaited indications on the U.S. economy and the monetary policy path after President Donald Trump signed a bill ending the longest government shutdown in the country's history.】

item.title: 部长表示，荷兰代表团将于下周前往中国参加耐克斯佩里亚会谈
item.description: 荷兰经济部长文森特-卡雷曼斯（Vincent Karremans）周四表示，荷兰政府代表团将于 "下周初 "前往中国，寻求解决芯片制造商耐克斯派瑞公司（Nexperia）争端。【原文：A Dutch government delegation will travel to China "early next week" to seek a solution in the spat over chipmaker Nexperia , Dutch Economy Minister Vincent Karremans said on Thursday.】

item.title: 谷歌因垃圾邮件政策遭欧盟反垄断调查
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周四遭到欧盟对其垃圾邮件政策的反垄断调查，出版商投诉称该政策损害了他们的收入，这使这家美国科技巨头面临再次被巨额罚款的风险。【原文：Alphabet's Google was hit with an EU antitrust investigation into its spam policy on Thursday following complaints from publishers who say it has hurt their revenues, putting the U.S. tech giant at risk of yet another hefty fine.】

item.title: 欧洲央行认为，由于市场对风险定价过低，欧洲绝不能放松银行监管
item.description: 欧洲央行监管主管克劳迪娅-布赫（Claudia Buch）周四表示，金融市场对地缘政治风险的定价过低，几乎所有欧元区银行都在一定程度上受到了地缘政治风险的影响，因此从长远来看，现在削弱监管可能会危及银行业的生存能力。【原文：Financial markets are underpricing geopolitical risks and nearly all euro zone banks are exposed to some extent, so weakening regulation now could jeopardize the sector's viability in the longer run, ECB supervisory chief Claudia Buch said on Thursday.】

item.title: 独家报道反无人机雷达公司 Chaos 在国防科技热潮中融资 5.1 亿美元
item.description: 反无人机雷达制造商 Chaos Industries 在上月完成的一轮融资中筹集了 5.1 亿美元，该公司首席执行官表示，这是投资者对新兴军事技术公司兴趣浓厚的最新迹象。【原文：Counter-drone radar manufacturer Chaos Industries raised $510 million in a funding round that closed last month, the company's CEO said, the latest sign of booming investor interest in emerging military technology firms.】

item.title: 中芯国际第三季度利润增长 29
item.description: 中国最大的合约芯片制造商中芯国际集成电路制造有限公司（0981.HK）周四公布，第三季度利润同比增长 28.9%。【原文：Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp 0981.HK ，China's largest contract chipmaker, reported on Thursday a 28.9% year-on-year increase in third-quarter profit.】

item.title: 西班牙在加密资产广告案中对马斯克的 X 公司罚款 580 万美元
item.description: 西班牙股市监管机构对埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）旗下的社交媒体平台 X 处以 500 万欧元（580 万美元）的罚款，原因是该公司未能确保一家利用 X 做广告的加密资产公司拥有提供投资服务的授权。【原文：Spain's stock market supervisor has fined Elon Musk-owned social media platform X 5 million euros ($5.8 million) for failing to make sure that a cryptoasset company that used X for advertisements had authorisation to provide investment services.】

item.title: 德国法院驳回股东对 Wirecard 破产分赃的要求
item.description: 德国一家高等法院驳回了已倒闭的支付公司 Wirecard 股东提出的索赔要求，他们要求从该公司剩余资产中获得更大份额。【原文：A German high court rejected a claim from shareholders in defunct payments company Wirecard who were seeking a bigger share of the firm's remaining assets.】

item.title: 需求保持稳定，中国 JD.com 季度收入超出预期
item.description: 周四，中国电子商务巨头京东商城（JD.com）的季度营收超过了市场预期，得益于政府补贴和较低的价格，消费者在其平台上的消费稳定。【原文：China's JD.com , topped market estimates for quarterly revenue on Thursday, as the e-commerce giant benefited from steady consumer spending on its platform thanks to government subsidies and lower prices.】

item.title: Embracer 在分拆咖啡渍之前的季度利润超出预期
item.description: 瑞典游戏公司 Embracer 周四报告称，其季度调整后营业利润下降了 79%，但超出了市场预期，原因是其核心游戏在按计划分拆 Coffee Stain 之前提高了玩家参与度。【原文：Swedish gaming company Embracer reported a 79% drop in its quarterly adjusted operating profit but beat market expectations on Thursday, as its core games boosted player engagement ahead of its planned Coffee Stain spin-off.】

item.title: 腾讯季度增长超预期，得益于游戏需求和人工智能服务
item.description: 中国最大的社交媒体和游戏公司腾讯周四公布，第三季度收入增长 15%，主要得益于强劲的游戏需求和不断扩展的人工智能服务。【原文：Tencent reported a third-quarter revenue growth of 15% on Thursday, as China's largest social media and gaming company benefited from strong gaming demand and expanding AI-driven services.】

item.title: 日元如何......再次绊倒投资者
item.description: 投资者对日元升值下了创纪录的赌注，以利用久违的经济复苏，而这恰好与美国经济放缓的预期相吻合。【原文：Investors laid a record wager on Japan's yen rising to take advantage of a long-overdue economic revival that coincided with expectations for a U.S. slowdown.】

item.title: 印度百康公司高层表示，美国建议将生物仿制药开发成本减半
item.description: 印度百康公司（Biocon）的一位高层管理人员周三表示，由于美国提议放宽对占其收入 60% 以上的复杂生物仿制药的临床测试，该公司预计开发复杂生物仿制药的成本将下降 50%。【原文：India's Biocon expects a 50% drop in costs for developing complex biosimilars as the United States has proposed to ease clinical testing for the drugs that make up more than 60% of its revenue, a top executive said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 丰田因发动机熄火风险召回逾 12.6 万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周四表示，丰田将在美国召回126,691辆Tundra和雷克萨斯汽车，原因是生产过程中产生的碎片可能导致发动机熄火。【原文：Toyota is recalling 126,691 Tundra and Lexus vehicles in the U.S. over manufacturing debris that may stall the engine, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Thursday.】

item.title: 城市收紧规定，Airbnb 转向西班牙乡村
item.description: 度假租赁公司 Airbnb 将在未来三年内投资推广西班牙的内陆城镇，以开发乡村旅游，因为在这个仅次于法国的全球游客第二多的国家，大城市限制短期租赁。【原文：Vacation rental firm Airbnb will invest in the promotion of inland towns across Spain over the next three years to tap into rural tourism, as major cities restrict short-term rentals in the world's second-most visited country after France.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，瑞典摩登时代正在为印度子公司 PlaySimple 寻求 4.5 亿美元的 IPO
item.description: 两位直接了解此事的消息人士称，瑞典娱乐公司摩登时代集团正计划在孟买为其印度游戏开发商首次公开发行 4.5 亿美元的股票。【原文：Swedish entertainment company Modern Times Group is planning to launch a $450 million initial public offering of its Indian game developer in Mumbai, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 报道称，ACS 和贝莱德将达成价值 270 亿美元的数据中心交易
item.description: 据《拓展》周四援引未具名市场消息人士的话报道，西班牙 ACS 公司即将与贝莱德旗下的全球基础设施合作伙伴公司（Global Infrastructure Partners）达成一项价值 230 亿欧元（约合 268 亿美元）的合作协议，共同开发数据中心。【原文：Spain's ACS is close to striking a 23 billion euro ($26.8 billion) partnership with BlackRock's Global Infrastructure Partners to develop data centres, newspaper Expansion reported on Thursday, citing unnamed market sources.】

item.title: 独家报道中国证券监管局长寻求批准下台
item.description: 知情人士透露，中国证券监督管理委员会主任吴庆已寻求批准下台，这对于去年为稳定中国股市而上任的监管部门负责人来说，将是一次出人意料的突然离职。【原文：China's securities watchdog chief, Wu Qing, has sought approval to step down, sources with knowledge of the matter said, in what would be an abrupt and unexpected exit for a regulatory head brought in last year to stabilise the country’s stock markets.】

item.title: 美国盟国加强人工智能管道建设，澳大利亚 AUKUS 基地将连接海底电缆
item.description: 路透社查阅的文件显示，澳大利亚的奥克斯（AUKUS）潜艇舰队基地及其附近地区正悄然与 Alphabet 旗下谷歌公司和 SUBCO 公司规划的三条强大的新型海底互联网电缆相连。【原文：Australia's AUKUS submarine fleet base and its vicinity are being quietly connected to three powerful new undersea internet cables planned by Alphabet's Google and SUBCO, documents viewed by Reuters show.】

item.title: 巴宝莉恢复增长，扭亏为盈初见成效
item.description: 巴宝莉（Burberry）周四公布的第二季度可比店铺销售额增长 2%，超出市场预期，原因是该英国奢侈品牌的扭亏措施初见成效，其中国业务也显示出复苏迹象。【原文：Burberry reported a 2% rise in second-quarter comparable store sales on Thursday, beating market expectations, as the British luxury brand's turnaround measures started to bear fruit and its China business showed signs of recovery.】
